programs.title: Ang Dating Daan
programs.description:
Ang Dating Daan is the longest-running religious show that started in the Philippines and is now being broadcast in different countries and in different languages. Originally a 30-minute radio program in 1980, Ang Dating Daan has progressed today with the inclusion of its interactive segment, Itanong Mo Kay Soriano - a live question-and-answer portion to address the audience's biblical queries.

Ang Dating Daan is produced by the Members Church of God International (MCGI), presided by Bro. Eliseo Soriano, who also hosts the religious program.

Ang Dating Daan is known for its straight-forward and frank broadcasting of the Gospel from the Bible, courtesy of Bro. Eli himself. This makes Ang Dating Daan unique among other religious programs in the country and abroad.

The program is now prominent in South and Central America under the English title, The Old Path, and dubbed in respective languages of the countries. It also airs in some parts of Europe, North America, Asia and African territories. Ang Dating Daan is also being broadcast in multimedia particularly though live streaming.

programs.title: A Song Of Praise
programs.description:
A Song of Praise Music Festival or ASOP is UNTV's hit praise song-writing competition. Professional and amateur song writers are encouraged to submit original and innovative compositions that give glory to our God.

As in all songwriting contests, prizes shall await the best song in the weekly, monthly and grand competitions. Winners shall be chosen by respected panel of judges such as Mon Del Rosario and Vehnee Saturno, among others.

The program is hosted by two equally talented artists and hosts in the entertainment industry - Toni Rose Gayda and Richard Reynoso.

programs.title: Bakit
programs.description: Bakit (Why) is a one-hour radio broadcast hosted by political and human rights activist Atty. Charito Planas. It offers fresh and valuable insights into current issues and events with Atty. Planas and prominent guests.

programs.title: Balita Kada Ora
programs.description:
Balita Kada Ora broadcasts hourly news bulletins throughout the day.

Anchored by Annie Rentoy, Bernard Dadis, Jun Soriao and Flor Perez, Balita Kada Ora delivers the most recent updates and information on top stories in the country.

programs.title: Get It Straight with Daniel Razon
Huntahan
programs.description:
Huntahan is a commentary program that deals with the most relevant issues of the country and the world. As the program title suggests, “Huntahan” is geared at disseminating information through simple conversations; reminiscent of how ordinary folks discuss controversial news in the privacy of their homes or in street corner gatherings.

Armed with the combination of experience and expertise, the light commentaries of the anchors are executed in an in-depth, objective and balanced manner. It aims to provide listeners with a good view and understanding of the stories behind news stories, thus serving as good foundation for opinion-forming. This program format makes it easier for avid listeners to draw together facts, figures and other pertinent information on matters that affect the society while enjoying a good laugh amidst the storm of information.

Huntahan is for those who are craving for intelligent discussions on the hottest issues in the country today.

programs.title: Ito Ang Balita
programs.description: Ito ang Balita, the late afternoon one-hour newscast of UNTV, covers and reports the headline-grabbing issues and subjects in the country, stripped off of the usual fare of tabloid media TV. To be true to its promise in delivering bold, fearless and intelligent alternative, Ito ang Balita makes sure its local and international pool of correspondents uphold and internalize the highest ideals of journalistic practice and ethics — that journalism work is public service. As an advocate of doing good deeds that will benefit people even for just a day, UNTV CEO Daniel Razon surprised the whole media landscape when he introduced his unconventional advocacy in news reporting Tulong Muna Bago Balita (Assist Before Reporting). Out of its present reportorial composition, UNTV established a news-and-rescue mission team to assist in delivering rescue in emergency situations. The advocacy reinvents the old way of thinking and practice of media coverage that is only confined to exclusive-hungry reporting to be called competitive, even to the point of sacrificing the welfare of people in need of help. To beef up the operation of this new and bolder news approach, Daniel Razon launched early in 2011 a news-and-rescue command center, an office UNTV dedicates to receiving and responding to calls for emergency.

programs.title: Make My Day
programs.description:
Make My Day is an issues-based essay on TV, hosted by noted economist, businessman and engineer, Mr. Larry Henares Jr.

For many years, the show maintains its stated purpose: to enlighten, inspire, educate, astound, delight, amuse and imbue with a sense of wonder. It does so through its host's treatment of broad range of topics that include economy, history, culture, science, politics, literature, the arts and more.

programs.title: Rotary In Action
Dear Kuya
programs.description:
DEAR KUYA is a two-hour program of UNTV-Radio La Verdad 1350 which goes on air during weekdays, from 10:00am to 12:00nn, hosted by veteran broadcast-journalist Kuya Daniel Razon.

Primarily, the program aims to bring back the glorious days when radio was still the basic source of information and entertainment. Hence, DEAR KUYA offers both information and entertainment – a substitute to the usual formats of programs being aired on the same time slots which are nothing but political bickering and exposes of anomalies.

Catering to all sectors of society, DEAR KUYA features profound discussions on interesting topics and issues that directly affect the people’s lives (like family relations, health, science and technology, and other relevant social problems). The discussion of each topic culminates with the words of wisdom and pieces of advice which will be given by the program’s resource person, Bro. Eli Soriano. As he always does, Bro. Eli’s advice is based on the teachings of the Holy Scriptures.

Soothing and inspiring music, which are relative to the topic/issue being discussed, are also played from time to time.

The program, likewise, aims to establish a healthy interaction with its listeners that is why it encourages them to send text messages and/or post their comments and reactions about the program in the different social networking sites. But since the program also wants to be of help to its listeners who are beleaguered by some problems, and they need some enlightenment and spiritual advice, they are encouraged to write about it and send it to the program’s host. The would-be chosen letter will receive a prize of P10,000.

The last hour of DEAR KUYA (11am to 12:00nn) is devoted to the chosen letter-sender whose story will be dramatized live by UNTV-Radio La Verdad’s voice talents, with Kuya Daniel as the narrator. At the end, Bro. Eli will, once again, give insights and pieces of advice which are all Bible-based.

You may send your questions, greetings, stories, and signal feedbacks thru:

TWITTER: @DearKuya
EMAIL: dearkuya@untvradio.com
ADDRESS: 907 EDSA, Brgy. Philam, QC

programs.title: Justice On Air
programs.description:
UNTV joins forces with the Department of Justice in bringing the vision and mission of the Department closer to the masses through their tie-up program Justice On Air, hosted by Kuya Daniel Razon and DOJ Assistant Secretary Geronimo Sy. The talk show aims to familiarize viewers with various agencies under the DOJ by featuring their functions and inviting the respective heads to discuss related issues and offer programs available to the masses in securing legal assistance from the government. The show also educates viewers on Philippine laws through trivia and definition of legal terms.

Justice On Air airs every Monday at 6:45 to 7:30 p.m. with reruns via Radio La Verdad 1350 every Wednesday at 3:00 to 4:00 pm.

programs.title: Frontliners
programs.description:
To intensify more public service, UNTV launched the program Frontliners that showcases the Department of Foreign Affairs and its various functions. Under the Department’s Strategic Plan, this show aims to provide people a comprehensive view of DFA and to heighten awareness of its mandate, services, programs, projects and events, as well as its accomplishments. It highlights Department of Foreign Affairs’ implementation of the three pillars of Philippine foreign policy.

This weekly one-hour program includes interviews with officials and the Department Secretary, office tours and detailed discussion on its functions and organizational structure. Frontliners is hosted by Mr. Public Service, Kuya Daniel Razon and Former Congressman Erin Tañada.

programs.title: Bayanihan
programs.description:
A public service program that provides the public a look at the campaign plan IPSP Bayanihan of the Armed Forces of the Philippines. The show also clarifies common misconceptions that the solution to the country’s peace problem can be directly dealt using military solutions, contrary to the intents of the government to address the insurgency using peaceful means.

Segments:

Ka Kosa, Ka Rancho - Take an inner look at the civilian groups who have enlisted themselves to collaborate with our soldiers in solving the peace problems confronting our nation. Learn their motivations and expectations as we journey towards the establishment of a peaceful Philippines.

Bayani ni Juan - Know what our soldiers are doing all over the country and in all levels in the performance of the AFP’s IPSP Bayanihan, learn how they collaborate with the communities they’re working and know their focus towards their jobs.

Puno’t Dulo - This segment would be showing the AFP’s top level’s guidance to its men and partners on how to effectively deal with the advocacy to win the peace without violating the laws and traditions being observed. It also essays the effect of the peace efforts to the communities.

Epektos Atbp - This segment tackles the tangible effects of IPSP Bayanihan and other developments arising from its implementation. Expect to view interviews with rebels who surrendered due to IPSP Bayanihan, the increasing demand for all combatants to finally have peace in our country, the glee and satisfaction of partner groups upon achievement of their purpose, the noted growth of a community that had decided to reject violence and war, or AFP citing its partner’s efforts.

programs.title: Magandang Morning with Friendly Nicky
programs.description:
Start your day with a dose of oldies but goodies music with Friendly Nicky!

Listen to classic and legendary songs from 50’s, 60’s and 70’s plus selected modern day hits. From time to time, the program also provides its listeners the hottest headlines with the live news reports from beat reporters to keep our listeners informed while doing their morning rituals.

programs.title: Serbisyong Pulis
programs.description: Serbisyong Pulis: Serbisyong Makatotohanan is a PNP radio program targets mass-based audience and utilizes the mass media to conduct massive public information campaigns through crime prevention; crime solution and public safety. It aims to raise the awareness of the public on the services being provided by the PNP to the public. The radio program co-produced by the PNP and Radio La Verdad 1350, tackles the pressing issues affecting the organization. Also highlighted in the radio program are the accomplishments of the PNP especially its field units and offices which serve as the cutting edge of the organization. Segments: Balitang Pulis – news items about the accomplishments of Philippine National Police or the latest issues in the organization Hero Cops/Bayaning Pulis – features the extraordinary, gallantry and heroic deeds of PNP personnel Text Messages/I-Report Mo Kay Tsip – reading text messages from concerned citizens through PNP text line 0917 847 5757 Payo Ni Tsip- safety tips brought to us by police community relations group on how to avoid being victimized by criminals Modus Operandi- latest scams and modus operandi of criminals

programs.title: Good Morning Kuya
programs.description: Filipino households are now waking up to brighter mornings with Good Morning Kuya's heightened and unmatched public services, trustworthy news reports, and sensible exchanges of stories and opinions. It also pulls together segments that bring relevant, rich and interesting information aiming to empower, educate and inspire the viewers.

programs.title: Tinig Ng Pilipino
programs.description: Tinig ng Pilipino is an hour-long program that fairly and thoroughly presents issues and stories of national interest. Hosted by former Quezon province representative Erin Tanada and TV personality Ms. Jackie Aquino, the program offers a venue for government officials to inform the public, and answer questions from them. Also, the program lives up to its title by welcoming comments and reactions from listeners on matters discussed by the hosts and their guests.

programs.title: Sa Likod Ng Isang Awit
programs.description: Take a stroll down memory lane with UNTV Radio’s Sa Likod ng Isang Awit. Hosted by Kuya Daniel Razon, the hour-long program brings back the good old days through classic, timeless hits. Listen to the golden melodies of the past and the voices of the icons whose music has transcended time and generations.  Be inspired and be delighted by the stories behind the requested songs as Kuya Daniel reads messages sent by listeners. Sa Likod ng Isang Awit will fill your afternoons with great musical entertainment.

programs.title: Radyo La Verdad Balita Sa Hapon
programs.description:
Be up-to-date with the latest current events affecting our country and the world with Radyo La Verdad Balita sa Hapon.

With an army of correspondents scattered around the Philippines and abroad, the program provides you a roundup of news and live reports regarding important topics ranging from politics, human interests, business and sports.

Radyo La Verdad Balita sa Hapon is anchored by Mr. Public Service , Kuya Daniel Razon and veteran broadcaster Annie Rentoy. To keep listeners abreast of what’s happening today, Radyo La Verdad Balita is aired daily from 4 o’clock to 4:30 in the afternoon.

programs.title: Mr. Public Service
programs.description:
One of the flagship programs of UNTV Radio La Verdad. Hosted by philanthropist Kuya Daniel Razon, the show is the perfect place wherein the inquiries of our fellowmen about various matters and issues (mostly medical, legal and government agency-related queries) are being aired and taken action upon immediately.

As the radio show’s name says, Mr. Public Service – Kuya Daniel Razon – serves as someone whom people can rely on to whenever they need aid. A helping hand indeed, the program is committed in all the more improving its capacity to give all-out public service, without expecting anything in return.

Genuine and truthful public service is the very thing the station aims to give to the people.

programs.title: Itanong Mo Kay Soriano
programs.description: Itanong mo kay Soriano (Ask Bro. Soriano) is a program produced by the Members Church of God International (MCGI) that features the question and answer portion of the weekly Bible Expositions.Bro. Eli, as the resource speaker in the Bible Expositions, gives intriguing answers to people's questions in their search for Truth. Questions are asked live to him then answers their questions using the Bible as basis.

programs.title: Bakas
programs.description:
Bakas Pilipinas is a two-hour Saturday evening program that tackles various issues about the Philippines. May it be about politics, environment, health, sports, host Kokoy Alano is sure to deliver insightful commentaries and opinions about news and trending topics that circulate in the country. 

This latest addition to UNTV Radio's programs is the perfect weekender show that will give you a round-up of what you need to know about current Philippine issues.
